task.title: Define a Data Source
task.shortdesc: Define a data source on theData Sources page.

prereq.p: Before defining a data source, you must configure the following:
Your users must include at least one Administrator and at least one Privacy Officer.
To configure users, you must first configure user authorizations. If you are applying access policies to the data source, you must first configure the access policies.

context.p: To define a new data source:

step.cmd: Open the Data Sources page, by clicking the Data Sources icon. in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The Data Sources page opens showing all defined data categories.

step.cmd: Click the New Data Source button.
step.info: The New Data Source screen opens.

chdesc.p: Mandatory. A descriptive name for the data source. Numbers, letters, spaces, and special characters are supported.
chdesc.note: Once you save a data source, the name cannot be edited. To change the name, you must delete the data source and reconfigure it with the correct name.

chrow.chdesc: Mandatory. The data category of the data source. Choose from the drop-down list of defined data categories. How do I define a data category?
Mandatory. The individual responsible overall for data stored in . The user must be a PHEMI Administrator. Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.

Mandatory. The individual responsible for defining the organization's governance policy and for approving access policies. The user must be a Privacy Officer. Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.
Mandatory. The individual responsible for approving dataset requests involving this data source. The user must be a PHEMI Administrator. Choose from the drop-down list of eligible users.
Optional. The kinds of document expected from this data source. Examples are Microsoft Word, Excel, or JSON.
Optional. A brief description of the kinds of documents expected from this data source.
Optional. Any additional notes for the data source.
Optional. A copy of the agreement allowing data to reside on . Only one data sharing agreement can be uploaded.

step.cmd: Save the data source information by clicking the Save Data Source button. The system confirms when the data source has been successfully saved.
